hackathon-description-text: At Flatbook, we want to build the future of hospitality. Which means we’re passionate about building technology that powers awesome travel experiences. We want to share this passion with you by inviting you to our first ever Travel Hackathon.
hackathon-eligibility: If you're a programmer, designer, or creator in Montreal looking to make something cool with some cool people, you're welcome!
hackathon-requirements: All submissions must be your own work, and completed within the duration of the hackathon.
hackathon-rules:
June 18th to June 19th. Hacking officially begins at noon, and runs for 24 hours. A more detailed schedule will be released soon!
TravelHacks is hosted at Flatbook's Montreal headquarters at 3875 Rue St. Urbain, third floor.
Yes, including all food and drink during the event. Transportation is on you, though!
Teams should be between 3 to 5 people.
Yes, all participants should have something to show by the end of the weekend. It doesn't even need to be polished, we just want everyone to share their hard work.
Don't worry, we'll be sure to match you up with some awesome people.
Anything you'd like, but we ask that you start a new project fresh. You can create web/mobile apps or hardware projects, as long as it fits the hackathon's theme. Feel free to use any third party API's. Projects will be judged on a number of categories, such as creativity, utility, technical difficulty, etc.
You and your teammates. Your team retains full ownership of whatever you choose to build.
Come out and learn! We'll have mentors around to provide guidance, and your team members will help you get started.
We just ask that you be respectful to others throughout the event. We want everyone to have an awesome time.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 in flatbook credits, redeemable at any flatbook location in the world.
$200 in flatbook credits, redeemable at any flatbook location in the world.
$200 in flatbook credits, redeemable at any flatbook location in the world.
$100 in flatbook credits, redeemable at any flatbook location in the world.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Just crazy enough it might work

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1x golden pineapple, the ultimate symbol of hospitality.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3875 Rue Saint-Urbain, Montréal, QC H2W 1T9, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
The all-around best travel-related hack, judging from the following criteria:

- technical difficulty
- design
- how polished the project is
- how useful the application is


PRIZE: $1000 Flatbook credits & GOLDEN PINEAPPLE

The most well-designed hack. The future of travel is in user experience, after all. Judging is based on the following criteria:
- User interface
- User experience
PRIZE: $200 Flatbook credits & GOLDEN PINEAPPLE

The most unique, original, useful idea that could change the face of travel and hospitality forever. Project must be acceptably complete to be eligible. Prize: $200 Flatbook credits & GOLDEN PINEAPPLE
Anything goes. Project must be acceptably complete to be eligible. Prize: $100 Flatbook credits & GOLDEN PINEAPPLE
Anything goes. Project must be acceptably complete to be eligible. Prize: GOLDEN PINEAPPLE
